Eugene Kuleshov wrote:

>   Does this mean that Elliote can't be wrong or make mistakes? Honestly, 
> he sent 3 emails to the list and looked into the JUnit's source code 
> only after first two. If he would bother to look to the source code at 
> first place he won't have to sent any emails here. 

I'd looked at the source code before. I just hadn't yet figured out what 
was happening. It took a response here to point me at the right place to 
look.

> You know, I've been 
> using this feature for quite long time (not to mention that is is also 
> outlined in JUnit cookbook, 

You mean this?

http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/cookbook/cookbook.htm

Actually it's not. Overriding runTest() is mentioned once, but it's 
never explained or used in the examples. In fact step 3 could be 
eliminated from that page completely to slightly simplify it. In 
practice, I've rarely seen runTest overridden in client code.

--
